metadata.title: Effect of large-scale testing platform in prevention and control of the COVID-19 1 pandemic: an empirical study with a novel numerical model 2 3 Qing Xie

abstract.text: Province and Huo-Yan Laboratory testing data into a novel differential model with non-22 linear transfer coefficients and competitive compartments, to evaluate the trends of 23 suspected cases under different nucleic acid testing capacities. 24

Results: Without the establishment of Huo-Yan, the suspected cases would increased 25 by 47% to 33,700, the corresponding cost of the quarantine would be doubled, and the 26 turning point of the increment of suspected cases and the achievement of "daily 27 settlement" (all daily new discovered suspected cases were diagnosed according to the 28 : medRxiv preprint 2 nucleic acid testing results) would be delayed for a whole week and 11 days. If the Huo-29

Yan Laboratory could ran at its full capacity, the number of suspected cases could 30 started to decrease at least a week earlier, the peak of suspected cases would be reduced 31 by at least 44% and the quarantine cost could be reduced by more than 72%. Ideally, if 32 a daily testing capacity of 10,500 could achieved immediately after the Hubei lockdown, 33 "daily settlement" for all suspected cases would be achieved immediately. 34

Conclusions: Large-scale and standardized clinical testing platform with nucleic acid 35 testing, high-throughput sequencing and immunoprotein assessment capabilities need 36 to be implemented simultaneously in order to maximize the effect of quarantine and 37 minimize the duration and cost. Such infrastructure like Huo-Yan, is of great 38 significance for the early prevention and control of infectious diseases for both common 39 times and emergencies. 40 41

To cope with that, the Wuhan government made another key strategic decision to build 77 an emergent clinical virus testing infrastructure on Jan 29 th , i.e. the Huo-Yan Laboratory, 78 with a testing capacity over 10,000 per day ( Figure 1 ). Huo-Yan was expanded into a 79 site of 2,000 m 2 within a week from an existing laboratory that continuously delivers 80 testing results. Since Huo-Yan put into use on Feb 5 th , its testing capacity kept stably 81 increasing due to the automated nucleic acid extraction device and optimization of 82 procedure. Then Huo-Yan have achieved 14,000 testing capacity per day on Feb 9 th 83 along with the original site and exceeded 20,000 testing capacity per day on Mar 1 st . 84 . The suspected patents were usually with characteristics of fever and 130 and control of COVID-19 ( Figure 3 ). Unlike the common dynamic model used only 141 linear differential equations, this model applied the increasement of testing capacity 142 into account. Since the quarantine measures in Hubei, the contact probability among 143 people was reduced, which significantly reduced the possibility of large-scale 144 transmission. Meanwhile, due to quarantine, people were more alert to fever and other 145 symptoms, leading to more patients surged into the hospital and a continuous 146 increasement suspected cases. The purpose of nucleic acid testing was to 1) identify 147 patients with COVID-19 from the uninfected, and allow them to be hospitalized; 2) 148 after the symptoms disappear, the inpatient with more than twice negative testing results 149 (the interval must be more than 24 hours) could be discharged [3] . 150

The conversion efficiency from suspected to hospital admission depended on the testing 152 capacity (TC(t)), the number of existing and newly discovered the suspected cases, 153 however there was a bottleneck of nucleic acid testing. As soon as the daily testing 154 capacity was greater than the existing suspected plus the newly suspected of the day, 155 the "daily settlement" of suspected cases could be achieved. 156

The effect of increased 192 testing capacity was significant, which was largely up to the government's decision and 193 the expansion of the hospitals and clinical testing laboratories (Figure 4) . 194 195 Due to the insufficient testing capacity at the beginning of the province-scale quarantine, 196 the number of suspected cases rose to over 23,000, which became a "dammed lake" for 197 delayed diagnosis and led to social panic. is the author/funder, who has granted medRxiv a license to display the preprint in (which was not certified by peer review) preprint 11th 2020 by WHO. The quarantine of an entire district, city or a region could be 222 adopted as part of the measures by the government. In Italy, for example, more than 15 223 million people were placed in the country-based quarantine on March 8 th [5] . Timely and 224 accurate clinical test is essential for identifying the infected, cutting off the transmission, 225

and protecting the susceptible. The large-scale, precise, and reliable testing capacity is 226 highly required to reduce the panic accompanied by the drastic quarantine measures. is the author/funder, who has granted medRxiv a license to display the preprint in (which was not certified by peer review) preprint

The diagnosis for over 30,000 203 suspected cases would be delayed, half of which are positive results and could cause 204 further transmission. The turning point of the increment of suspected cases would be 205 delayed for 6 days and the achievement of "daily settlement" would be realized at established testing capacity was fully used, over 22,800 suspected cases could be 209 diagnosed on time rather than being delayed, and accordingly, the isolation cost could 210 be reduced by at least 72%, the turning point of the increment of suspected cases could 211 arrive one week earlier, and "daily settlement" could be realized 12 days in advance. 212213Under the ideal scenario, if Hubei Province was capable of carrying out more than 214 10,500 tests per day at the very beginning of the epidemic, there would be no "suspected 215 cases" in the daily official COVID-19 epidemic report, but only the number of 216 diagnosed cases, i.e., either positive or negative, because all of the suspected cases 217

FIGREF2.text: the testing capacity is a systematic project, among which the qualified 229 laboratory spaces, the standardize of training medical panels, the supplement of the 230 equipment, reagents, consumables and protective materials, and the automation of the 231 testing procedure were of most importance. Here are the suggestions deduced from large-scale standardize testing platform and QC protocols were the premise of 235 in the quarantine, which were the prerequisite for the diagnosis of suspected cases, 236 isolate infectious patients, release isolation of convalescent and uninfected healthy 237 population, and also the screening of key communities and groups. The practice 238 from the centered platform could be summarized and replicated to other laboratories. 239The quality of the diagnostic kits and the accuracy, timeliness, safeties of the 240 laboratories must be constantly compared and inspected. Unstandardized testing 241 process would cause inconsistency in testing results and led to distrust on the testing 242 results. 2432) Encourage the laboratories to increase testing capacities and keep continues 244 delivery results at the same time. During emergencies, any changes in the testing 245

FIGREF3.text: the outsourcing clinical testing laboratory the same priority and responsibility 250 as the in-house laboratories. Despite of the high efficiency of the outsourcing 251 laboratory, some hospitals are not willing to perform the outsourcing diagnostic 252 tests just because they regard the risk of inaccurate testing results of the outsourcing 253 laboratories "incontrollable". 254 4) Central planning of the diagnostic testing and comprehensive tracking of the 255 potential testing capability to achieve "daily settlement". Once there are standardize 256 testing capacity, arrange the samples to fill the excess capacity immediately. 257 5) Sufficiently supplement the sampling kits and the corresponding trainings to the 258 medical panels. Other issues that require training on the sampling process including 259 the barcoding and information input of the samples, and the inactivation of the 260 pathogen before testing. 261 6) Large-scale and standardized clinical laboratory should be regarded as 262 infrastructure for both common time and emergencies against contagion, and should 263 be put into use as early as possible in any epidemic. A good estimation of the testing 264 capacity for nucleic acid testing of COVID-19 could be over 10,500 samples per 265 day for a region of 60 million population with over 43,000 infected patients. 266 267 With Huo-Yan Laboratory as a model, combining with high-throughput sequencing, 268 nucleic acid detection, immunoprotein analysis and other large-scale standardized and 269 automated analysis methods, we can build infrastructure in the field of public health 270 against the pandemic, so that large and small cities could have their own detection 271capabilities of 100 to 1,000 or 10,000 people when facing various epidemics, we can 272 take it easy to ensure our life safety, biological safety and economic safety. 273

This work is to serve as an empirical reference to regions where COVID-19 279 needs to be prevented and controlled as it is now spreading globally. TABREF0.text: no suspected 85 cases each day) raised by Hubei Provincial government starting by Feb 16 th . On Feb 86 19 th , the sixth edition of the diagnosis and treatment plan for the novel coronavirus 87 disease [3] recalled the practice of using imaging features of pneumonia for the diagnosis 88 of COVID-19 in Hubei Province. 89 Testing is the key to the prevention and control of infectious diseases, for only by 91 identifying the infected can they be isolated and treated, as well as to stop the 92 transmission. So far, there was no empirical data and numeric model to clarify the 93 impact of standardized and large-scale clinical testing platform on the prevention and 94 control of contagion. Here we present a novel differential model with non-linear 95 transfer coefficients and competitive compartments to evaluate the trends of suspected 96 cases under different nucleic acid testing capacities. 97 The number of daily received samples and the maximum testing capacity of Huo-Yan 101 Laboratory were taken into the model for the estimation of the testing (Figure 1). The 102 data of suspected cases, diagnosed cases, hospitalized patients and recovered patients 103 each day which released by the Health Commission of Hubei Province were used for 104 validation of the model. 105Estimation of the number of nucleic acid testing carried out in Hubei Province 107As the response to the rapid increment of suspected cases, the testing capacity of the 108 hospitals, the local disease control and prevention institutions and the clinical testing 109 laboratories in Hubei Province increased from c.a. 3,000 to over 30,000 tests per day. 110In the period of simulation (Feb 25 th -March 6 rd ), Huo-Yan had finished over 163,000 111 testings by March 6 th , with a team of 130 personals. Besides, the 20 teams of 83 112

TABREF1.text: personals sent by CCDCP together with local lab professionals and supporting 113 personals, had finished 105,641 testings by the end of February. In Wuhan, the 23 most 114 qualified hospitals could perform over 7,000 tests per day. The specifics of the testing 115 delivered 40%-50% of the testing results in Hubei Province. 125Estimation of the total infected population of novel coronavirus and other pathogens 127
